Context: Dr. Mary Ellen Avery (1927–2011) was best known for her research on breathing problems encountered by premature infants—a condition now known as Respiratory Distress Syndrome. A study conducted in 2002 estimated that Dr. Avery’s work had helped save the lives of over 800,000 babies.
Title: Passage 3 Audio Clip: Interview with Dr. Mary Ellen Avery
Copyright: Interview with Dr. Mary Ellen Avery, from the National Library of Medicine. In the public domain. The clip begins at 0:00 and ends at 1:26.
